FeedItems.Title: NuGet 1.7 Released
FeedItems.Summary: We’re happy to announce that we released NuGet 1.7 today. This release includes several new features as well as over 75 bug fixes. Details are in the NuGet 1.7 Release Notes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[MSA] Pass the error messages from AADv2 to gallery" (#6581) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Addresses #6100 - It is likely that the users were seeing 500 due to unhandled exceptions in AADv2 OIDC middleware. With this change, we will handle all the exceptions/failures that might occur during authentication and surface the received error message to the user for easier analysis and debugging.
Add an api for reading the etag for an azure blob.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Embedded license file ingestion for Gallery" (#6580) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses #6545

New column was added to GalleryDB to contain the type of the embedded license file (plain text or markdown). Storage is implemented for the case when no async validation pipeline is present.

I ended up diverging from the spec which prescribed storing a presence of an embedded file as a bool flag because this way for the local storage case we lose the document type information. So an enum was introduced that persists that information in DB.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Builds broken because package signature file entry is invalid" (#7414) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @AArnott on September 10, 2018 23:18_

As discussed [on this appveyor forum](https://help.appveyor.com/discussions/problems/16600-appveyor-suddenly-totally-broken), AppVeyor builds recently started breaking for me.  Feodor Fitsner kindly came up with a minimal repro that suggests that the .NET Core 2.1 packages on nuget.org have bad signatures.

**Repro**

Create a test-nuget.csproj file with these contents:

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp1.0;netcoreapp2.0;netcoreapp2.1</TargetFrameworks>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```

Rename or remove your `%userprofile%\.nuget\packages` folder.

Restore packages for `test-nuget.csproj` *using msbuild*:

```ps1
msbuild /t:restore /p:RestoreDisableParallel=true,TreatWarningsAsErrors=true
```

This produces these errors:

```
  Restoring packages for D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj...
<snip/>
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.DotNetAppHost 2.0.0.
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.App 2.1.0.
D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj : error NU3005: The package signature file entry is invalid. The central directory header field 'compression method' has an in
valid value (8).
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.DotNetHostPolicy 2.1.0.
D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj : error NU3005: The package signature file entry is invalid. The central directory header field 'compression method' has an in
valid value (8).
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.Platforms 2.1.0.
D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj : error NU3005: The package signature file entry is invalid. The central directory header field 'compression method' has an in
valid value (8).
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.Targets 2.1.0.
D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj : error NU3005: The package signature file entry is invalid. The central directory header field 'compression method' has an in
valid value (8).
  Installing NETStandard.Library 2.0.3.
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.DotNetHostResolver 2.1.0.
D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj : error NU3005: The package signature file entry is invalid. The central directory header field 'compression method' has an in
valid value (8).
  Installing Microsoft.NETCore.DotNetAppHost 2.1.0.
D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj : error NU3005: The package signature file entry is invalid. The central directory header field 'compression method' has an in
valid value (8).
  Generating MSBuild file D:\temp\test-nuget\obj\test-nuget.csproj.nuget.g.props.
  Generating MSBuild file D:\temp\test-nuget\obj\test-nuget.csproj.nuget.g.targets.
  Restore failed in 32.27 sec for D:\temp\test-nuget\test-nuget.csproj.
```

Interestingly, this only repros while there are multiple target frameworks specified. Reducing it to just `netcoreapp2.1` eliminates the error.

_Copied from original issue: dotnet/sdk#2523_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget sources add strips credentials from a user's NuGet.config" (#7200) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe

NuGet version: 4.7.1.5393

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

### Background

We run an internal NuGet server that requires authentication. 
To configure the feed to use, we place a `nuget.config` file in the source code repository, but configure the credentials for the feed in the user's local `NuGet.Config`

### Repro steps

1. Place a `nuget.config` in a source code repository or empty folder. 
   
    Example:

   ```xml
   <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
   <configuration>
     <packageSources>
       <clear />
       <add key="Feed1" value="http://example.com/feed1" />
     </packageSources>
   </configuration>
   ````

2. Add the credentials for "Feed1" to `%APPDATA%\NuGet\NuGet.config`. 

    Example (I used `ClearTextPassword` for the example but the behavior is the same when using an encrypted password):

   ```xml
   <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
   <configuration>
     <packageSources>
       <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
     </packageSources>
     <packageSourceCredentials>
       <Feed1>
         <add key="Username" value="USERNAME" />
         <add key="ClearTextPassword" value="PASSWORD" />
       </Feed1>
     </packageSourceCredentials>
   </configuration>
   ```

3. Run `nuget restore` or `nuget install` in the repository. NuGet combines the feed url and credentials from the different config files and succeeds to download packages.
4. Run `nuget sources add -name Feed2 -source http://example.com/feed1` from a directory outside the repository so NuGet does not load the repository-config file.
5. Inspect `%APPDATA%\NuGet\NuGet.config`. As expected, the source "Feed2" was added.
    However, the credentials for Feed1 are no longer present in the config file:

Expected:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
    <add key="Feed2" value="http://example.com/feed2" />
  </packageSources>
  <packageSourceCredentials>
    <Feed1>
      <add key="Username" value="USERNAME" />
      <add key="ClearTextPassword" value="PASSWORD" />
    </Feed1>
  </packageSourceCredentials>
</configuration>
```

Actual:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
    <add key="Feed2" value="http://example.com/feed2" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget restore treats url source as a local path if runtime, packages and combination of local path and url as sources are used" (#7413) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget appends nuget source url to the current work dir and treats it as a local folder instead of url when I pass runtime, packages and two sources: one local path + one url

When I remove packages or runtime or both it starts to work

--------------
dotnet --info:
.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):

Runtime Environment:

Host (useful for support):

  Commit:  290303f510

---------------
Repro:
1. dotnet new console
2. dotnet publish -r win-x64 --packages nuget --source ./ --source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

Error:
`C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.403\NuGet.targets(114,5): error : The local source 'C:\Workspace\test\https:\api.nuget.org\v3\index.json' doesn't exist. [C:\Workspace\test\test.csproj]`

[1.log](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/2494080/1.log)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "VSTS build agent dotnet restore not using configfile argument correctly" (#7210) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @tommorganshaw on June 29, 2018 16:39_

## Steps to reproduce
VSTS build agent running on an on-premise server behind a corporate firewall and proxy server, so the NuGet config needs define the proxy settings.

The build definition uses the .Net Core template. The dotnet restore step uses the default settings, except for defining "Feeds in my NuGet config" which points to NuGet.config that includes proxy settings.

The complete command that the build step executes is:

`"2018-06-26T14:10:02.2401648Z [command]"C:\Program Files\dotnet\dotnet.exe" restore D:\BuildAgents\1\_work\27\s\MyDotNetCoreWebsite\MyDotNetCoreWebsite.csproj --configfile D:\BuildAgents\1\_work\27\Nuget\tempNuGet_43655.config --verbosity Detailed"`

It appears that when the build runs, it takes a copy of the NuGet.config file, renames it a and drops it in a temp directory:

`"D:\BuildAgents\1\_work\38\Nuget\tempNuGet_43654.config"`

This file does include the correct proxy settings:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <config>
    <add key="http_proxy" value="http://10.1.0.10:8080" />
  </config>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="NuGet official package source" value="http://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

## Expected  behavior

Dotnet restore should use the `tempNuGet_43654.config` file when running the restore operation.

## Actual behavior

Dotnet restore is _always_ using the User-level NuGet.config in the following location:

`"C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.config"`

This file does not include the necessary proxy settings and, consequently, the restore operation fails saying "A connection with the server could not be established".

```
2018-06-29T16:16:09.3058376Z          C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.4\NuGet.targets(103,5): error : Unable to load the service index for source http://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json. [d:\BuildAgents\1\_work\38\s\MyDotNetCoreWebsite\MyDotNetCoreWebsite.csproj]
2018-06-29T16:16:09.3058625Z        C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.4\NuGet.targets(103,5): error :   An error occurred while sending the request. [d:\BuildAgents\1\_work\38\s\MyDotNetCoreWebsite\MyDotNetCoreWebsite.csproj]
2018-06-29T16:16:09.3058895Z        C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.4\NuGet.targets(103,5): error :   A connection with the server could not be established [d:\BuildAgents\1\_work\38\s\MyDotNetCoreWebsite\MyDotNetCoreWebsite.csproj]
```

Some additional notes:

- Running the dotnet restore command from the command prompt has the same issue.

- Placing NuGet.config files with the proxy setting the project directory, or in various places in the directory hierarchy makes no difference.

- Other NuGet restore operations using .NET Framework on the build server complete correctly without the same issue. They appear to be using their own NuGet.config files with proxy settings and not relying on the APPDATA NuGet.config.

- Putting the proxy settings into the NuGet.config in AppData works and the restore operation can complete. However, there are other operations that fail so this can't be the resolution.


## Environment data
`dotnet --info` output:

C:\>dotnet --info
.NET Command Line Tools (2.1.4)

Product Information:
 Version:            2.1.4
 Commit SHA-1 hash:  5e8add2190

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  6.3.9600
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win81-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\2.1.4\

Microsoft .NET Core Shared Framework Host

  Version  : 2.0.6
  Build    : 74b1c703813c8910df5b96f304b0f2b78cdf194d








_Copied from original issue: dotnet/cli#9587_

we have nuget.config with 3 feed 
1) nuget.org
2) ravendb ci

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget creates invalid binding redirects for reference assemblies" (#7393) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Visual Studio 15 creates binding redirects for reference assemblies.

```
<dependentAssembly>
  <assemblyIdentity name="System.Runtime" publicKeyToken="b03f5f7f11d50a3a" culture="neutral" />
  <bindingRedirect oldVersion="0.0.0.0-4.1.2.0" newVersion="4.1.2.0" />
</dependentAssembly>
```

This is invalid because it forces the runtime to load the reference assembly rather than the framework assembly. This results in the following error:

```
An unhandled exception was generated during the execution of the current web request. Information regarding the origin and location of the exception can be identified using the exception stack trace below.
--

[BadImageFormatException: Cannot load a reference assembly for execution.]  [BadImageFormatException: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Runtime' or one of its dependencies. Reference assemblies should not be loaded for execution.  They can only be loaded in the Reflection-only loader context. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131058)]    System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly._nLoad(AssemblyName fileName, String codeBase, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly locationHint, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks) +0    System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.nLoad(AssemblyName fileName, String codeBase, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly locationHint, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks) +36    System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.InternalLoadAssemblyName(AssemblyName assemblyRef, Evidence assemblySecurity, RuntimeAssembly reqAssembly, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean throwOnFileNotFound, Boolean forIntrospection, Boolean suppressSecurityChecks) +152    System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.InternalLoad(String assemblyString, Evidence assemblySecurity, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, IntPtr pPrivHostBinder, Boolean forIntrospection) +77    System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.InternalLoad(String assemblyString, Evidence assemblySecurity, StackCrawlMark& stackMark, Boolean forIntrospection) +21    System.Reflection.Assembly.Load(String assemblyString) +28    System.Web.Configuration.CompilationSection.LoadAssemblyHelper(String assemblyName, Boolean starDirective) +38  [ConfigurationErrorsException: Could not load file or assembly 'System.Runtime' or one of its dependencies. Reference assemblies should not be loaded for execution.  They can only be loaded in the Reflection-only loader context. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131058)]    System.Web.Configuration.CompilationSection.LoadAssemblyHelper(String assemblyName, Boolean starDirective) +726    System.Web.Configuration.CompilationSection.LoadAllAssembliesFromAppDomainBinDirectory() +196    System.Web.Configuration.CompilationSection.LoadAssembly(AssemblyInfo ai) +45    System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.GetReferencedAssemblies(CompilationSection compConfig) +172    System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.GetPreStartInitMethodsFromReferencedAssemblies() +91    System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.CallPreStartInitMethods(String preStartInitListPath, Boolean& isRefAssemblyLoaded) +111    System.Web.Compilation.BuildManager.ExecutePreAppStart() +156    System.Web.Hosting.HostingEnvironment.Initialize(ApplicationManager appManager, IApplicationHost appHost, IConfigMapPathFactory configMapPathFactory, HostingEnvironmentParameters hostingParameters, PolicyLevel policyLevel, Exception appDomainCreationException) +695  [HttpException (0x80004005): Could not load file or assembly 'System.Runtime' or one of its dependencies. Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Show source repository information for packages on nuget.org" (#30) at NuGet/Announcements
```
Events.RelatedBody:
The spec to **Show source repository information for packages on nuget.org** , is ready for **review**:

|Spec wiki|Discussion issue|
|:----------|:------------------|
|[Show source repository information for packages on nuget.org](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Show-source-repository-information-for-packages-on-nuget.org) | https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4941 |

**Note**: This is a short term feature to just light up the repository information on nuget.org using the `<repository>`  metadata in the nuspec. We plan to revisit the detailed functionality, in future.
